div.div: κνί̄ση : the steam or savor of burnt offerings, originally fat, esp. that of the caul or diaphragm, in which the thighs of the victim were wrapped. It was then laid upon the fire and burned, together with pieces of flesh piled upon it, Il. 1.460.
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
